citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility’s attending veterinarian (AV) has not visited the premise since 2021. The facility’s program of veterinary care
denotes site visits by the AV will occur annually, but the licensee has yet to initiate contact with the AV to schedule a visit
for the regulated animals housed at the facility. Consistent, regularly scheduled visits by the veterinarian provides a
measure of quality assurance and helps sustain satisfactory oversight and communication by the vet with the facility. The
facility shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian
or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and regularly
scheduled visits to the premises of the breeder.

The facility has yet to update any of their acquisition and disposition records for the hedgehogs on-hand at the facility.
Acquisition and disposition records, including offspring born at the facility, are necessary to accurately track and identify
animals being used in regulated activities, as well as aid in the detection of movement of animals upon relocation to a new
site.
The facility shall make, keep and maintain records that fully and correctly include all the required acquisition and
disposition information, including: the name and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired, the USDA
license number of the person if licensed or the vehicle license number and state and driver’s license number and state if
not licensed, the name and address of the person to whom an animal was given/sold, the date of acquisition or
disposition, the species of animal and the number of animals involved.

The facility has yet to develop and document a contingency plan. A plan is important to be in place in preparation for
unexpected disasters or events, as well a detailed strategy to address the needed handling, treatment, transportation,
housing, and care of the animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. The facility shall develop and document an
appropriate contingency plan available for review upon USDA inspections.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
